Key Arguments: The legislation exempts mainstream media and the government, who are seen as major sources of misinformation.
The government and media are accused of spreading false information about COVID-19 vaccines.
The submission argues that free speech is necessary to discern truth from misinformation.
The government is accused of pushing false narratives on climate change and other issues.
The Bill is seen as a tool to silence dissenting voices and enforce harmful policies.
Main Themes: Distrust in government and mainstream media
Concerns about free speech and censorship
Belief in government manipulation and hidden agendas
Notable Quotes: The people it exempts from the Bill's scope, namely the mainstream media and the government itself, are the biggest offenders when it comes to spreading false information.
We need free speech so that we can find out for ourselves what the truth is, and what is something with an evil hidden agenda.
This Bill will silence voices telling the truth and lead people down the garden path to their ultimate destruction.
